meanings.definition: Unwanted or unnecessary elements or material
meanings.sent1: The cruft in the garage needs to be thrown away.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned out the cruft from her closet to make more space.
meanings.sent3: The cruft of old toys made the room look cluttered.
meanings.sent4: His mind was filled with cruft, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The cruft of leaves in the gutter caused a blockage.

meanings.definition: To remove or clean up unnecessary elements or material
meanings.sent1: Please cruft the unnecessary files from the computer.
meanings.sent2: He crufted the old paperwork to make the office more organized.
meanings.sent3: She decided to cruft her wardrobe and donate the clothes.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together to cruft the outdated information.
meanings.sent5: It's time to cruft the expired items from the pantry.
